p: Around 918,000 tons of fish oil is extracted every year and the amount deriving from waste should increase from 40 to 45% [ 92]. Due to the expanding demand for Ï‰-3 FAs concentrates, oil extraction from fishery waste represents an appealing alternative option for their production, especially if considering that fish oil does not compete with food resources [ 93]. On these bases, the development of an industrial-scale concentrates production route that allows reducing both costs and environmental impact preserving DHA and EPA properties is essential.
